meanings.definition: A person or entity that receives a bill or note for payment.
meanings.sent1: The billetee carefully checked the bill before making the payment.
meanings.sent2: The company sent the bill to the billetee for processing.
meanings.sent3: The billetee joked that they were the 'bill master' of the office.
meanings.sent4: As the billetee of the group, she was responsible for handling all the invoices.
meanings.sent5: The billetee's desk was always covered in payment reminders.

meanings.definition: To issue or provide a bill or note for payment.
meanings.sent1: The accountant will billetee the invoices at the end of the month.
meanings.sent2: Please billetee the bill for the services rendered last week.
meanings.sent3: The small business owner billeteed the customers with a smile.
meanings.sent4: She billeteed the clients promptly to ensure timely payments.
meanings.sent5: The treasurer billeteed the members for their annual dues.
